InputSentence3: Bad Katie was delighted with the Valentine's Day gift she thought was hers.
InputSentence4: Out of pity, Carl took her out on a date that night.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Carl and Stacey enjoyed their date.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Katie found out, and then she was very hurt.

InputSentence1: Derek drove at night.
InputSentence2: Suddenly his car stalled and he was forced to pull over.
InputSentence3: Smoke was coming from under the bonnet.
InputSentence4: He noticed this and quickly got out of the car.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He walked away and never looked back.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: It took four hours for his car to cool down and he was able to drive home.

InputSentence1: Rex has always loved birds.
InputSentence2: One day, his friend suggested they go birdwatching in a local park.
InputSentence3: Rex and his friend saw finches, sparrows and other birds.
InputSentence4: Later, they talked about the birds they had seen while eating ice cream.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: They had a good time.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Rex decided he never wanted to do that again.

InputSentence1: My grandmother was on her deathbed.
InputSentence2: He told me to always take time for the little things.
InputSentence3: I try to live this every day.
InputSentence4: I try to enjoy the things that people usually take for granted.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I never liked the things my grandmother said.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I thank my grandmother for giving me a philosophy of life.

InputSentence1: Tina invited Todd to dinner.
InputSentence2: He went to the fish market for something special.
InputSentence3: He was frightened by all the fish eyes staring at him.
InputSentence4: He left without buying anything.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tina decided to go out to dinner.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: That night they had fish for dinner, with extra fish eyes.

InputSentence1: Wallace was passionate about gardening.
InputSentence2: He has been gardening since the age of ten.
InputSentence3: Wallace continued to pursue his passion during his college years.
InputSentence4: Wallace has a degree in biology.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He used his knowledge to become a professional gardener.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He used his knowledge to become a professional taxi driver.

InputSentence1: Tam felt defeated as he looked out over the dandelion-covered lawn.
InputSentence2: Children came to the nursery, one of them was picking dandelions for Tam.
InputSentence3: Tam had an idea.
InputSentence4: Before they left, Tam told the children to choose a bouquet for their mum.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tam took the children to Canada.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The children were picking bouquets.

InputSentence1: John and Bill have signed up for a scavenger hunt.
InputSentence2: The scavenger hunt was at their school.
InputSentence3: They went from classroom to classroom looking for clues.
InputSentence4: John and Bill found all the clues.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: And they won.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: But they were not interested in winning.
